paragraphs.text: Raiko was elected as the first president of the United Republic of Nations in 171 AG.

paragraphs.body: The president is the democratically elected leader of the ${link_0}. As the nation's head of state, the president exercises control over a large majority of the United Republic's sectors, including law enforcement. He also serves as the commander-in-chief of the ${link_1}. The president is elected for a four-year term but may run for reelection.
paragraphs.text: The president is the democratically elected leader of the United Republic of Nations. As the nation's head of state, the president exercises control over a large majority of the United Republic's sectors, including law enforcement. He also serves as the commander-in-chief of the United Forces. The president is elected for a four-year term but may run for reelection.

paragraphs.body: The presidency was founded in 171 ${link_0} shortly after the end of the ${link_1} to replace the ${link_2}, which had been deemed too outdated to pursue the modern public interests. During the first election, ${link_3} won against a single opponent and became the United Republic's first president.
paragraphs.text: The presidency was founded in 171 AG shortly after the end of the Anti-bending Revolution to replace the United Republic Council, which had been deemed too outdated to pursue the modern public interests. During the first election, Raiko won against a single opponent and became the United Republic's first president.

paragraphs.body: In 174 AG, another presidential election was organized, and Raiko enlisted ${link_0} as his campaign manager in hopes to be reelected for a second term. Despite his unpopularity, he was convinced he would win as he was running unopposed. His growing conflict with ${link_1} ${link_2}, however, spurred ${link_3} to consider running against him. In the end, Zhu Li won the election, becoming the Republic's second President.
paragraphs.text: In 174 AG, another presidential election was organized, and Raiko enlisted Wenyan as his campaign manager in hopes to be reelected for a second term. Despite his unpopularity, he was convinced he would win as he was running unopposed. His growing conflict with Avatar Korra, however, spurred Zhu Li Moon to consider running against him. In the end, Zhu Li won the election, becoming the Republic's second President.

paragraphs.body: The president has a large amount of power over the United Republic, serving as commander-in-chief of the entire military and the overseer of the Republic City Police Department, allowing them to prioritize certain police efforts. They can also grant presidential pardons to individuals accused or convicted of crimes against the state.
paragraphs.text: The president has a large amount of power over the United Republic, serving as commander-in-chief of the entire military and the overseer of the Republic City Police Department, allowing them to prioritize certain police efforts. They can also grant presidential pardons to individuals accused or convicted of crimes against the state.

paragraphs.body: The president is voted to office by the people of Republic City during an open election. In the first election of 171 AG, there were two candidates, both of whom rallied financial support from businesses and other benefactors in order to fund their campaign.
paragraphs.text: The president is voted to office by the people of Republic City during an open election. In the first election of 171 AG, there were two candidates, both of whom rallied financial support from businesses and other benefactors in order to fund their campaign.

paragraphs.body: Raiko ran for reelection in 174 AG, originally unopposed, though lost when ${link_0} entered the race and won by a landslide.
paragraphs.text: Raiko ran for reelection in 174 AG, originally unopposed, though lost when Zhu Li Moon entered the race and won by a landslide.
